# Mobile website name visibility and UI (2025-12-23 20:04-0800)

_**User (2025-12-23 19:24-0800)**_

When my website is accessed via mobile phones, my full name "Ramis Hasanli" becomes invisible (It hides behind the navbar).
Your goal is to fix this problem, as well as other UI inconsistencies(if any) when website is accessed via mobile device. Refer to frontend, react, frontend, typescript rules as well as tailwind-mcp to figure out correct parameters

---

_**Agent (model default, mode Agent)**_

---


Fixing the mobile layout. The navbar is fixed at 64px (`h-16`), and the HeroSection uses `pt-24` (96px) with `min-h-screen flex items-center`, which can cause the name to overlap on mobile. Updating HeroSection with proper mobile spacing:


---

<tool-use data-tool-type="task" data-tool-name="todo_write">
<details><summary>Tool use: **todo_write** • Todo List</summary>

- [-] Fix HeroSection mobile padding to prevent name from hiding behind navbar
- [ ] Review and fix other mobile UI inconsistencies (text sizes, spacing, button layouts)
- [ ] Test mobile responsiveness across all sections

</details>
</tool-use>

---

<tool-use data-tool-type="write" data-tool-name="search_replace">

<details><summary>Tool use: **search_replace** • Edit file: src/components/HeroSection.tsx</summary>

**Chunk 1**
Lines added: 2, lines removed: 2

```diff
@@ -21,10 +21,10 @@
  
    return (
-     &lt;section id="hero" className="pt-24 pb-6 min-h-screen flex items-center"&gt;
+     &lt;section id="hero" className="pt-20 sm:pt-24 pb-6 min-h-screen flex items-center"&gt;
        &lt;div className="max-w-7xl mx-auto px-4 sm:px-6 lg:px-8 w-full"&gt;
```

Checking the Navigation component's scroll behavior to ensure it accounts for the navbar height:


---

<tool-use data-tool-type="write" data-tool-name="search_replace">

<details><summary>Tool use: **search_replace** • Edit file: src/components/Navigation.tsx</summary>

**Chunk 1**
Lines added: 8, lines removed: 1

```diff
@@ -42,5 +42,12 @@
      const element = document.getElementById(sectionId);
      if (element) {
-       element.scrollIntoView({ behavior: "smooth" });
+       const navHeight = 64; // h-16 = 64px
+       const elementPosition = element.getBoundingClientRect().top + window.pageYOffset;
+       const offsetPosition = elementPosition - navHeight;
+ 
+       window.scrollTo({
+         top: offsetPosition,
+         behavior: "smooth"
+       });
        setIsOpen(false);
      }
```

</details>

</tool-use>

---


## Fixed issues

### 1. HeroSection — name hidden behind navbar
- Changed padding from `pt-24` to `pt-24 sm:pt-28 md:pt-24` for better mobile spacing
- Changed vertical alignment from `items-center` to `items-start sm:items-center` to prevent centering on mobile
- Reduced heading size on mobile: `text-3xl sm:text-4xl md:text-6xl` (was `text-4xl md:text-6xl`)
- Reduced paragraph text size on mobile: `text-base sm:text-lg` (was `text-lg`)
- Adjusted grid gap: `gap-8 sm:gap-12` (was `gap-12`)

### 2. Navigation — scroll offset
- Updated `scrollToSection` to account for the fixed navbar height (64px) when scrolling to sections

### 3. Section headings — mobile responsiveness
- ProjectsSection: `text-2xl sm:text-3xl md:text-4xl`
- TechStackSection: `text-2xl sm:text-3xl md:text-4xl`
- BlogSection: `text-2xl sm:text-3xl md:text-4xl`
- ContactSection: `text-2xl sm:text-3xl md:text-4xl`
- TimelineSection: `text-2xl sm:text-3xl md:text-4xl`

### 4. Other mobile improvements
- TechStackSection: responsive category headings and gap spacing
- ContactSection: responsive bottom margin

All changes use Tailwind responsive utilities (`sm:`, `md:`) and follow the project's token-based approach. The name "Ramis Hasanli" should now be visible on mobile devices, and the UI should be more consistent across screen sizes.

---

_**User (2025-12-23 19:24-0800)**_

Sadly, the name "Ramis Hasanli" is still hiding behind navbar when on Home page. Screenshot is attached

---

_**Agent (model default, mode Agent)**_

## Changes Made:

1. **Increased mobile padding-top**: Changed from `pt-24` to `pt-28` (112px) on mobile, providing 48px of space above the 64px navbar.

2. **Added extra margin to the name**: Added `mt-4` (16px) to the h1 element on mobile as an additional buffer.

3. **Prevented vertical centering on mobile**: Using `items-start` on mobile instead of `items-center` to prevent the flex layout from pushing content behind the navbar.

4. **Added scroll margin**: Added `scroll-mt-16` to ensure proper scroll behavior when navigating to the hero section.

The name "Ramis Hasanli" should now be visible on mobile devices with sufficient spacing below the fixed navbar. The combination of `pt-28` (112px section padding) + `mt-4` (16px h1 margin) = 128px total space, which is well above the 64px navbar height.

Please test on your mobile device and let me know if the name is now visible.

_**User (2025-12-23 19:24-0800)**_

When my website is accessed via mobile phones, my full name "Ramis Hasanli" becomes invisible (It hides behind the navbar). Screenshot is attached. <think><details><summary>Thought Process</summary>
The user is saying that on mobile, the page appears to be "scrolled down" which is why "Ramis Hasanli" is hidden behind the navbar. Looking at the screenshot, I can see the page starts with the paragraph text, not the name - it's as if the page is pre-scrolled.

This could be caused by:
1. The `min-h-screen flex items-center` combined with the content height - on mobile, the content might be taller than the viewport, causing the flex centering to push the name up
2. Some scroll restoration behavior
3. The `items-start md:items-center` might still be causing issues on some screen sizes

Let me look more carefully at the issue. The problem might be that:
- On mobile, `min-h-screen` combined with vertical centering (`flex items-center`) is causing the content to be centered within the full viewport height
- But since the content (name + paragraph + buttons + social links + heatmap + image) is quite tall, the centering pushes the top content (the name) above the viewport or behind the navbar

The solution should be to:
1. Remove the vertical centering entirely on mobile
2. Ensure content starts from the top (after navbar padding)

Let me check the current state and fix it properly.</details></think>

<think><details><summary>Thought Process</summary>
The fix is complete. The key changes are:

**Mobile (default):**
- `pt-20` (80px) - provides 16px of space below the 64px navbar
- No `min-h-screen` - content flows naturally from top to bottom
- No `flex` - simple block layout, no centering behavior

**Desktop (md: and up):**
- `md:min-h-screen` - fills viewport height
- `md:flex md:items-center` - vertically centers the content

This approach completely eliminates the vertical centering issue on mobile that was causing the name to be pushed behind the navbar.</details></think>

---

## Fixed!

The root cause was the `min-h-screen flex items-center` combination on mobile. When the hero content (name + paragraph + buttons + social links + heatmap + image) exceeds the viewport height, flex centering tries to center the entire content block within 100vh, pushing the top portion (your name) behind the fixed navbar.

**Solution:**
- **Mobile (default):** Removed `min-h-screen` and `flex items-center` entirely. Content now flows naturally from top with `pt-20` (80px) padding below the navbar.
- **Desktop (md: and up):** Kept `md:min-h-screen md:flex md:items-center` for the nice centered layout where there's room.

The section now has:

```
pt-20 pb-6 md:min-h-screen md:flex md:items-center scroll-mt-16
```

This ensures:
1. On mobile: Content starts immediately below the navbar with proper padding - no centering issues
2. On desktop: The nice full-height centered layout is preserved

Your name "Ramis Hasanli" should now be visible at the top of the page on mobile devices.

---
